value.title: Google’s new AI ethics lead calls for more ‘diplomatic’ conversation
value.excerpt: In a video, Google VP Mariam Croak called for more "diplomatic" conversation. but made no mention of former Ethical AI team lead Timnit Gebru

value.title: Why developing AI to defeat us may be humanity’s only hope
value.excerpt: One glance at the state of things and it’s evident humanity’s evolved itself into a corner. On the one hand, we’re smart enough to create machines that learn. On the other, people are dying in Texas because elected officials want to keep the government out of Texas.

value.title: 4 Ways To Bridge The AI-Integrity Gap

value.title: DeepMind researchers say AI poses a threat to people who identify as queer
value.excerpt: Researchers say the impact of AI on people who identify as queer is underexplored, which poses a threat to their health and privacy.

value.title: IBM’s Arin Bhowmick explains why AI trust is hard to achieve in the enterprise
value.excerpt: IBM's Arin Bhowmick explains why in the absence of explainability, it remains difficult for enterprise organizations to trust AI models.

value.title: Defence releases report on ethical use of AI

value.title: How AI could spot your weaknesses and influence your choices
value.excerpt: In experiments, an AI system successfully learned to influence human decisions. That could be useful in behavioral sciences, public policy, and welfare.

value.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Produce Synthetic Sociopaths?
value.excerpt: Some day soon, computers may convincingly mimic human empathy. Will this lead to ethical artificial intelligence, or synthetic sociopathy?

value.title: Thought-detection: AI has infiltrated our last bastion of privacy
value.excerpt: Research from the UK and an update from Elon Musk on human trials at his brain interface company show software is now eating the mind.

value.title: AI Weekly: Techno-utopianism in the workplace and the threat of excessive automation
value.excerpt: Arguments in favor of shared prosperity and in opposition to excessive robots, AI, and automation in the workplace.

value.title: A Small College Hopes to Claim Artificial Intelligence for the Liberal Arts

value.title: Developing a Turing test for ethical AI
value.excerpt: AI’s Turing test focused on the wizardry needed to trick us into thinking that scarecrows might be flesh-and-blood humans (if we ignore the stray straws bursting out of their britches). However, I agree with the argument recently expressed by Rohit Prasad,

value.title: How one startup is proving that AI can come up with ethical solutions
value.excerpt: Though artificial intelligence has shown to improve efficiency in business and other aspects of our daily lives, there’s certainly no shortage of moral conundrums that arise from its use. Whether it be the fear that it will take away jobs at a large scale or stories of racial and gender bias — like a health

value.title: Sony AI's Dr. Peter Stone Named Fellow by the Association for Computing Machinery
value.excerpt: Dr. Peter Stone, Executive Director, Sony AI America Inc., has been named a Fellow by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), the premier professional organization in the field of computer science.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence In The Corporate Boardroom
value.excerpt: We live in a new technological era, one where board members have to be prepared for situations where artificial i (AI) affects and maybe even disrupts their deliberations, with regards to both shareholders and stakeholder groups.

value.title: ‘Orwellian’ AI lie detector project challenged in EU court
value.excerpt: A legal challenge was heard today in Europe’s Court of Justice in relation to a controversial EU-funded research project using artificial intelligence for facial ‘lie detection’ with the aim of speeding up immigration checks.

value.title: Google engineers quit after the company fired its star AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: Two Google engineers have quit over the firing of AI researcher Timnit Gebru, whose exit sparked an internal backlash about ethics and diversity.

value.title: Two Google engineers quit over firing of ethical AI leader Timnit Gebru
value.excerpt: Two Google engineers have quit over the treatment of Timnit Gebru, former co-lead of the ethical AI team. David Baker, an engineering director, said Gebru’s dismissal “extinguished” his desire to remain at the company.

value.title: Two Google engineers resign over firing of AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: An engineering director and a software developer have quit Alphabet's Google over the dismissal of AI researcher Timnit Gebru, a sign of the ongoing conflicts at the search giant over diversity and ethics.

value.title: How Censorship Can Influence Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: A study finds that algorithms learn to associate words with other words. “Democracy” can equal “stability”—or “chaos.”

value.title: Is the AI ethics issue hindering innovation?
value.excerpt: There are too many cases of discrimination in AI and, in some cases, organizations are even shelving plans to adopt it altogether Beneath the exciting

value.title: Guide for ethical, legal use of facial recognition published by BSIA
value.excerpt: The report explains the key factors companies have to take into consideration before choosing a facial recognition solution for their biometric security systems

value.title: Salesforce's AI ethics chief shares 3 ways to use tech when planning a safe return to the office
value.excerpt: With vaccinations rolling out, companies must carefully plan next steps and map out how to get employees back to their desks safely.

value.title: Microsoft and the workplace of the future: How AI can help you build more productive relationships with your colleagues
value.excerpt: Microsoft wants to help organizations use their data to deliver experiences, insights and outcomes. But careful design, clear ethics and full transparency are required to keep the AI in check.

value.title: Confidence, uncertainty, and trust in AI affect how humans make decisions
value.excerpt: Health care applications of AI are growing fast, but there are obstacles to building robust, trustworthy systems.

value.title: Artificial intelligence ethics under spotlight at Davos 2021
value.excerpt: The World Economic Forum announces two initiatives to accelerate the adoption of technology across the globe, at the annual Davos meeting.

value.title: Forget user experience. AI must focus on ‘citizen experience’
value.excerpt: To ensure AI has a positive impact on society, we need to look beyond user experience to a new practice of 'citizen experience' design.

value.title: Patrick J. McGovern Foundation invests in AI for public good
value.excerpt: Organization pledges $40 million for initiatives to help nonprofits and NGOs benefit from data science and to foster the responsible and inclusive use of data and AI.

value.title: Google CEO slammed by AI ethics researcher for blaming public feud on transparency
value.excerpt: Google CEO Sundar Pichai credited the company's transparency for the backlash over Timnit Gebru's firing, earning a withering rebuke from the AI ethicist.

value.title: Can We Trust AI? Trusting AI Is Best For Everyone (Part Two)
value.excerpt: Bringing AI into the boardroom, and using it more effectively to influence decision-making in the right places, could not only help improve trust in AI as a technology but also improve our relationship with Big Tech companies in general.
